intro: Salpiglossis arniatera, commonly known as the rainbow flower, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its vibrant, tubular flowers that come in a variety of colors. The plant typically grows as an annual herb, reaching heights of up to 3 feet, with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are pollinated primarily by hummingbirds due to their shape and nectar-rich structure. Salpiglossis arniatera is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and as a cut flower.
